Setting Lightning Launcher as your default android home app will allow other apps to add shortcut icons to the home screen.

 If you want to do that, check Set Up Shortcuts/Shortcut Settings for shortcuts TO Lightning Launcher.

Websites in Lightning Launcher Easily Access Websites & Web Apps
Websites will appear as apps on your home screen. They will open in Lightning Browser (a separate app which you will be prompted to install).
 
You can also search Google, YouTube, or ApkPure using the search bar.
Audio in the Background
After being minimized, websites can continue running, and can play and record audio in the background - even while in a game! (You may experience latency or stutters in calls)
 
Websites open via a search will not run in the background unless added with the Add Page to Launcher (+) button.
Browser Selection
On Quest devices, you can select to launch in the Meta Quest browser, which supports VR web content, but not background audio.

Icon Update/Clear Settings Lightning Launcher caches icons and banners for apps for faster loading.
 
You can clear this cache to refresh any icons which might have changed. Lightning Launcher will download icons for official Quest Games and app from the internet.
 
By clearing the icon cache, you can also redownload all such icons. This is useful if they seem to be missing! You can also set custom icons for apps by placing them in a folder ON THIS DEVICE, then pressing on the icon in the app info popup.
 
If you want, you can also clear all of these. Doing so will also clear the cache.

Shortcuts Shortcut Options Shortcuts make it easier to open the launcher. 
It's highly recommended that you set up use at least one. Unfortunately, Android TV limits the functionality of accessibility services and third-party launchers. Return to Settings
Android TV Launcher Manager Install a third-party application which may allow you to change the default home on Android TV. 
This requires ADB Debugging to be enabled, and may not work on every device. 
 
If it doesn't install through here, look up "Android TV Launcher Manager XDA", then manually download & install.
Or… Just Use the Back Button! If you just use the back button on your remote, instead of the home button, you will always come back to Lightning Launcher. 
 
Pressing back once you get to the launcher will just toggle edit mode, keeping you from accidentally returning to the default launcher.
Each addon can be used for another window of Lighting Launcher. You may use an addon as an alternate icon on the dock with or without activating it.
Feed Shortcut Install then activate to open Lightning Launcher whenever you hover over the Horizon Feed button on the dock.
Instead of using this shortcut, you can disable the Explore app & reboot to remove the feed icon. To restore the icon & fix this shortcut, re-enable the Explore app, then reboot your headset.
(Optional) Disable the Explore app Re-Enable Explore app
